general_skills.title: Systematic Exploration
general_skills.principle: Search every plausible surface or container exactly once before revisiting; prioritize unopened or unseen locations to cover the whole room methodically.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Anytime the goal object count is not yet met and unexplored locations remain.

general_skills.title: Immediate Acquisition
general_skills.principle: As soon as a required object becomes visible and reachable, take it before moving elsewhere to avoid losing track or re-searching.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Upon first visual confirmation of a goal-relevant object.

general_skills.title: Destination First Policy
general_skills.principle: After picking up a goal object, navigate directly to the known target receptacle and place it before resuming further search.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Holding any goal object while its target location has been identified.

general_skills.title: Track Counts & Progress
general_skills.principle: Maintain an internal counter of how many goal objects are still needed; stop searching or terminate episode only when the counter reaches zero.

general_skills.title: Use State-Changing Tools Early
general_skills.principle: For tasks requiring heated/cooled/clean objects, acquire the object, then immediately use the nearest suitable appliance to change its state before any placement.
general_skills.when_to_apply: After picking up an object that must change temperature or cleanliness.

general_skills.title: Establish Spatial Relations
general_skills.principle: When a goal specifies a relation (under/inside/on), first locate the reference object, adjust its state if needed (e.g., turn lamp on), then search the specified spatial region for the target object or place it there.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Tasks containing spatial prepositions like under, inside, on, in_front_of.

general_skills.title: Open Before Judging Empty
general_skills.principle: Treat any closed container as unexplored; open it and inspect contents before deciding that the goal object is absent.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Encountering a closed drawer, cabinet, fridge, microwave, etc.

general_skills.title: Avoid Redundant Rechecks
general_skills.principle: Record which locations and containers have been fully inspected; do not revisit them unless new evidence suggests their contents changed.
general_skills.when_to_apply: After the first full pass of a location or when considering next search target.

general_skills.title: Plan with Landmarks
general_skills.principle: Continuously update and reference a map of known object and container locations to choose shortest paths and prevent aimless wandering.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Each time a new furniture piece, container, or goal object is observed.

general_skills.title: Progressive Goal Decomposition
general_skills.principle: Break tasks into ordered sub-goals: (1) locate object, (2) obtain or transform it, (3) locate destination/reference object, (4) satisfy spatial relation/placement, completing each sub-goal before moving to the next.
general_skills.when_to_apply: At the start of every episode and whenever the environment state invalidates the current sub-goal.

general_skills.title: Efficient Relation Search
general_skills.principle: When the goal pairs two objects (A under/on/inside B), restrict search for A to locations near B and vice-versa, instead of treating them independently.
general_skills.when_to_apply: On goals that mention both a target object and a reference object.

general_skills.title: Terminate Only On Success
general_skills.principle: Issue the 'done' action exclusively after validating that all goal conditions are met; otherwise continue searching or correcting object states.
general_skills.when_to_apply: Before ending an episode or when the agent believes the task is complete.

pick_and_place.title: Systematic First-Pass Search
pick_and_place.principle: Maintain a checklist of all visible and closed containers/surfaces; open or inspect each unseen candidate exactly once before revisiting any location.
pick_and_place.when_to_apply: After reading the goal and before acquiring every required object.

pick_and_place.title: Grab When Seen
pick_and_place.principle: Whenever a needed object is visible and reachable, immediately take it before moving elsewhere—do not leave targets uncollected.
pick_and_place.when_to_apply: Upon first sight of an unheld object that matches the goal specification.

pick_and_place.title: Transform Before Transport
pick_and_place.principle: If the goal specifies a state change (e.g., heated, cooled, cleaned), perform the transformation at the nearest appropriate appliance before heading to the final destination.
pick_and_place.when_to_apply: Right after acquiring an object that must change state.

pick_and_place.title: Place Before More Search
pick_and_place.principle: When holding any goal object and the target location is known and reachable, navigate there and place it immediately, then resume searching if more items are needed.
pick_and_place.when_to_apply: While carrying a required object and the destination has been identified.

pick_and_place.title: Track Counts for Multiples
pick_and_place.principle: Maintain a tally of how many target objects are required, held, and already placed; stop searching only after the placed count meets the goal.
pick_and_place.when_to_apply: Throughout tasks demanding two or more instances of the same object.

look_at_obj_in_light.title: Seek Lamp Surfaces First
look_at_obj_in_light.principle: Head straight to furniture that commonly hosts a desklamp (desk, sidetable, nightstand) because the target must end up under that light.
look_at_obj_in_light.when_to_apply: Right after parsing a look-at-object-under-desklamp goal.

look_at_obj_in_light.title: Switch Lamp On
look_at_obj_in_light.principle: Issue 'use desklamp' as soon as you reach it so the light condition is satisfied before or immediately after handling the target object.
look_at_obj_in_light.when_to_apply: Upon arriving at a desklamp that is currently off.

look_at_obj_in_light.title: Acquire Or Fetch Target
look_at_obj_in_light.principle: If the target is on the lit surface, 'take' it; if found elsewhere, pick it up and carry it back to the lit lamp area.
look_at_obj_in_light.when_to_apply: Whenever the target object becomes visible, whether under the lamp or not.

look_at_obj_in_light.title: Systematic Surface Search
look_at_obj_in_light.principle: On each candidate lamp surface, look, open nearby containers/drawers once, then move on—ensuring all plausible lamp locations are covered.
look_at_obj_in_light.when_to_apply: After the lamp at the current surface is on and the target hasn’t been found.

look_at_obj_in_light.title: Prevent Action Loops
look_at_obj_in_light.principle: Avoid toggling the same lamp or re-examining the same empty spot; if no progress after one full check, relocate to a new plausible lamp location.
look_at_obj_in_light.when_to_apply: When repeated identical actions yield no new observations or objects.

clean.title: Phase-Ordered Plan
clean.principle: Always execute clean tasks in the fixed sequence: 1) locate & acquire target object, 2) bring it to an available water source/sink to clean, 3) navigate to final location, 4) place object.
clean.when_to_apply: As soon as the goal specifies the object must be clean before placement.

clean.title: Pick Before You Wander
clean.principle: If the target object is visible or discovered, take it immediately; never leave it behind to explore other places, as possession enables direct cleaning and prevents redundant searches.
clean.when_to_apply: After visually confirming the presence of the target object on any surface or inside an opened container.

clean.title: Sink First for Cleaning
clean.principle: Upon holding the target object, go straight to the nearest sink, basin, or faucet and issue the clean/use command before any placement attempts.
clean.when_to_apply: Once the target object is in hand and its required state is ‘clean’.

clean.title: Systematic Container Sweep
clean.principle: When the object isn’t found on open surfaces, iterate through all unopened or unexamined containers in the room before revisiting already-checked spots to avoid search loops.
clean.when_to_apply: After initial obvious surfaces are empty and the target object remains unfound.

clean.title: State Verification Before Drop
clean.principle: Always inspect or infer the object’s state after cleaning; if still not confirmed clean, re-clean before final placement to satisfy goal conditions.
clean.when_to_apply: Immediately after a cleaning action and before placing the object at its target location.

clean.title: Use Location Priors
clean.principle: Begin search at the most probable category-specific surfaces (e.g., kitchenware on countertop/stove, food on dining table) to minimize exploration steps and avoid aimless roaming.
clean.when_to_apply: At the very start of the task to choose the first search destination for the target object.

heat.title: Secure Exact Target First
heat.principle: Always identify and pick up the exact object type named in the goal before interacting with the microwave or destination, ignoring look-alikes (e.g., don’t substitute a mug for a cup).
heat.when_to_apply: After spotting any candidate object or during initial search phase; before opening/using appliances.

heat.title: Systematic One-Pass Search
heat.principle: Search each plausible surface or closed container once by opening it and inspecting contents; mark searched spots mentally to avoid redundant revisits.
heat.when_to_apply: While locating the target object and you have not yet found it.

heat.title: Open Then Heat
heat.principle: Upon reaching the microwave with the target in hand, always open the door, place the object inside, and execute the heat action before leaving.
heat.when_to_apply: Immediately after navigating to the microwave with the target object held.

heat.title: No Appliance Before Object
heat.principle: Do not move to or interact with the microwave or final placement location until the target object is picked up, preventing wasted navigation steps.
heat.when_to_apply: Whenever you are tempted to head to microwave/destination without holding the required object.

heat.title: Direct Post-Heat Placement
heat.principle: After heating, navigate straight to the specified destination and place the object once, avoiding extra exploration or detours.
heat.when_to_apply: Right after the heating action completes and the object is in hand.

cool.title: Systematic Object Hunt
cool.principle: Sweep every unvisited surface and open each closed container until the exact required object is found; never loop over already-checked empty spots.
cool.when_to_apply: Immediately after receiving a cool-task and before any object is held.

cool.title: Confirm Object Match
cool.principle: After picking up an item, verify it matches the requested type; if not, drop it and resume the search.
cool.when_to_apply: Whenever you acquire an object but the goal object is still unmet.

cool.title: Prep Cooling Appliance
cool.principle: Locate the fridge first and open it so it’s ready for use before or immediately after grabbing the target object.
cool.when_to_apply: As soon as the fridge comes into view or right after acquiring the target object.

cool.title: Enforce Cooling Before Placement
cool.principle: Do not place the target object in its final location until you have successfully executed a cooling action with the fridge.
cool.when_to_apply: When holding the correct object and before any placement action is attempted.

cool.title: Direct Post-Cooling Delivery
cool.principle: Once the object is cooled, navigate straight to the destination and place it without extraneous detours or re-searching.
cool.when_to_apply: Right after the cooling action succeeds.

examine.title: Pair Objects Early
examine.principle: When both the target and desklamp are seen on the same surface, immediately pick up (or leave) the target there and use the desklamp without moving elsewhere.
examine.when_to_apply: Upon first observation that [Target_Object] and desklamp share the current location.

examine.title: Grab Target First
examine.principle: If you see the target but not the desklamp yet, take the target immediately so you can carry it to wherever the desklamp is found.
examine.when_to_apply: Target object is visible and not yet held, while desklamp’s location is unknown.

examine.title: Shortcut To Tool
examine.principle: Once holding the target, navigate straight to the nearest known desklamp and issue a single USE command—no intervening searches or detours.
examine.when_to_apply: Target object is in inventory and at least one desklamp location is known.

examine.title: Single Toggle Rule
examine.principle: Use (toggle) the desklamp only after the target is in hand or co-located; avoid repeated or premature toggles that waste steps.
examine.when_to_apply: About to interact with a desklamp during an examine task.

examine.title: Explore New Surfaces
examine.principle: If either the target or the desklamp hasn’t been found, systematically check unvisited surfaces/containers instead of re-inspecting places already confirmed empty.
examine.when_to_apply: Location of required object remains unknown after current area is exhausted.

examine.title: Lock In Observed Items
examine.principle: After spotting either required object, do not leave without acting—pick it up (if target) or note its location (if desklamp) to prevent costly backtracking loops.
examine.when_to_apply: Just observed a required object during scanning of a surface or room.

common_mistakes.description: Agent repeatedly revisits the same already-searched locations or containers instead of exploring new ones.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: The agent lacks an explicit memory or policy for tracking explored areas, so its search strategy degenerates into local loops.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Maintain an exploration map that records which rooms/containers have been fully inspected and prioritize unvisited or unopened candidates until all reasonable options are exhausted.

common_mistakes.description: Agent decides a closed container is empty without opening it, causing missed discoveries of target objects.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Heuristic shortcuts or cost-sensitive policies misjudge the effort of opening containers versus the value of inspecting them.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Always open and inspect every plausible closed container at least once before ruling it out, using a checklist of unopened containers in the current room.

common_mistakes.description: Agent ignores or walks away from target objects that are already visible and reachable.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Perception-action coupling is weak, so detected objects are not tightly linked to action plans that acquire them.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Embed a perception buffer that immediately queues pick-up actions for visible goal objects and interrupts any ongoing exploratory loop.

common_mistakes.description: Agent keeps searching after acquiring enough items because it loses track of how many targets have been collected.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Internal counters for goal progress are missing or not updated reliably when objects are picked up or placed.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Maintain explicit numerical goals and increment/decrement them on every successful pickup or placement, triggering transition to the next sub-goal when counts are satisfied.

common_mistakes.description: Agent fails to deliver a held target object to the known destination, instead continuing to wander.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Planning separates acquisition and delivery but lacks a mechanism to reprioritize delivery once an item is in hand.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Adopt a hierarchical policy that, upon holding a goal object, immediately switches to a high-priority ‘deliver-to-goal’ subtask before resuming further search.

common_mistakes.description: Agent completes spatial placement while skipping required state changes (e.g., cleaning, heating).
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: The agent conflates object presence with goal satisfaction and omits checking or planning for property predicates like cleanliness or temperature.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Integrate state precondition checks into the planner so that placement actions are only considered valid after verifying and, if necessary, executing the requisite state-changing operations.

common_mistakes.description: Agent repeatedly toggles or examines objects that yield no new information or progress.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Exploration heuristics do not penalize redundant actions, leading to low-utility action loops when uncertain.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Implement novelty or information gain metrics that discourage repeating identical actions unless the environment state has changed since the last attempt.

common_mistakes.description: Agent mishandles spatial relations (e.g., ‘under’, ‘inside’, ‘behind’) by inspecting only obvious surfaces and ignoring less visible sub-locations.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Parsing of relational language is not coupled with a comprehensive enumeration of environment affordances that can realize those relations.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: During task parsing, generate explicit search targets for all sub-locations associated with the reference object (drawers, shelves, underside) and iterate through them systematically.

common_mistakes.description: Agent forgets which object it is holding, leading to unnecessary pickups, drops, or misplacements.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: The internal state does not persistently encode the identity and status of the carried object across time steps.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Maintain a dedicated ‘hand inventory’ structure updated after every pickup/drop, and consult it before issuing navigation or interaction commands.

common_mistakes.description: Agent executes inefficient action sequences by searching for each required object serially rather than batching placements or leveraging proximity.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Lack of multi-goal planning causes the agent to treat each instance independently, resulting in unnecessary travel and toggling.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Use planning algorithms that group similar subtasks, allowing the agent to collect all required objects in one pass before performing consolidated delivery or transformation steps.

common_mistakes.description: Agent prematurely terminates or stalls without having observed any candidate objects that satisfy the goal.
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Termination criteria rely on step limits or subjective confidence rather than verified goal completion signals.
common_mistakes.how_to_avoid: Only allow ‘done’ actions when explicit goal predicates are met; otherwise, continue targeted exploration of remaining unvisited rooms and containers.
